text: Elwin Nelson "Doc" Romnes (January 1, 1909 – July 21, 1984) was an American professional ice hockey left winger and centre who played 11 seasons in the National Hockey League (NHL) with the Chicago Black Hawks, New York Americans and Toronto Maple Leafs organizations. He won a Stanley Cup in 1934 and in 1938 with the Black Hawks. He also won the Lady Byng Trophy in 1936. ==Other websites== * Category:1909 births Category:1984 deaths Category:American Hockey Association (1926–42) players Category:American ice hockey centers Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Lady Byng Memorial Trophy winners Category:New York Americans players Category:Toronto Maple Leafs players Category:Sportspeople from Minnesota Category:Stanley Cup champions
title: Elwin Romnes
